conditions.today: 6 AM—Kaboom! The upper elevations of Rendezvous Mountain have been blasted with 8" of unadulterated blower over the past 24 hours, supplying you with high-grade materials to showcase your personal powder powers. Prepare for slightly cooler temperatures and mostly cloudy conditions today as we sit inside the calm between two storms. Highs will peak in the upper teens on the deck of Corbet's Cabin and in the mid-30s in the Village. In contrast to your raging dopamine rush, light and variable winds will keep the atmospheric vibe relaxed as they barely breeze above 5 or 10 mph. The pow has returned to merge your white-room dreams with reality. So, embrace the momentary insanity, and don't be too ashamed to let all your friends see. Because when you go ripping by, it'll whip 'em right into a frenzy. -Lege
conditions.yesterday: 6AM - Well, it looks like Old Man Winter decided to show up (which is more than we can say for some offensive lines). Whether you're looking to celebrate or forget your troubles, one thing is for sure: storm skiing is the perfect pairing for your Monday aspirations.  Light to moderate snow will fall most of the day with up to an inch per hour falling over Tetons above 8,500 ft. Today's much needed precipitation will be accompanied by strong winds out of the West with gusts up to 60mph possible across ridges and peaks. Temperatures will cool slightly from their morning highs - 36 degrees at the base and 25 degrees at the summit for mid-day projections. Break out the gore-tex and meet us on the slopes! -Orion

recommendations: Fresh corduroy on Bivouac - challenging for advanced skiers
Fresh corduroy on Gros Ventre (Upper) - perfect for intermediate skiers

morningBrief.headline: Fresh Tracks for Days
morningBrief.body: It's a 8" day. You know what to do. First chair or regret it.
